> " No Rodimus, this isn't all your fault. A lot of it if not a=
ll of it, is actually my fault. The day we fought off Hydras's lackies two =
years ago, I had managed to deal with the ones I was fighting against and s=
aw that you, Nightlight and Windlord were in desperate need of help. So I w=
ent as fast as I could, to try and divert enemy fire away from you, but I f=
ailed to check a blind spot in my rear view mirror, and I was shot from beh=
ind, rendering me inoperable and blind. If I had just taken more careful su=
rvey of what was around me, none of this, including what happened to you, w=
ould never have happened. Now, now is the time to make it up to you. We'll =
fight them together. Scorponok doesn't scare me, none of them do. All right=
 Jhiaxus, don't expect me to make this easy for you because I'm not! As I'v=
e said to Scorponok before, I will not fold to any of you, no matter what d=
amages you instill on me!

Rodimus almost smiled as Tuscon tried so hard to=
 take the blame, or at
least some of it. He shook his head slightly, "Becau=
se you didn't
check a blind spot all of this happened?" Rodimus turned to l=
ook back
at the oncoming Decepticons, "No, no one can say that. I have my o=
wn
blame to bear, but this time I will bear it rather than trying to . .
. =
" Rodimus' voice stopped mid sentence as he struggled with something
inside=
 his head!

Jhaxius smiled as he, Cyclonus and Scourge walked foward, Cyclo=
nus'
strides quickly bring him to the fore. "Did you think we did not have
=
this in mind?" Cyclonus said. "Rodimus, as long as he lives will still
belo=
ng to Hydras!"

Behind Cyclonus, Jhiaxus was holding a device, a miniature =
version of
what was used originally to change Windlord and Rodimus into the=
 evil
versions of themselves.

"Yes." Jhiaxus said, "The original program h=
ad gone dormant but still
remained. It was only a matter of bringing the so=
ftware back online."

Rodimus shook his head as he mouthed the word, 'NO'. =
He held his head
and fell to his knees, his palms against his ears as if he=
 were trying
to block out voices that he was hearing.

Scorponok chuckled a=
s he resumed his robot mode and he and Scourge
brought up the rear, "Yes Br=
other." Scorponok said to Rodimus, "Come
back to us, we need you." his voic=
e sarcastic and condescending.

Rodimus' armor slowly began to blacken agai=
n and then shift red as if
on fire. He glanced over at Tuscon, his optics s=
till the amber of his
Autobot upbringing, "Get Nightlight . . . all of them=
 out of here!" he
said, his voice hoarse and intense, "This must stop here,=
 now!"

Rodimus glanced at a message that he received from Perceptor . .  .=


> "6 cycles - P."

Rodimus smiled as his armor shifted black again, "Yes =
brother I hear
you." Rodimus said as he began to walk forward. Behind his b=
ack he
motion to Tuscon to go, "GO!" he said fiercely.

Rodimus stopped nea=
r the device that Perceptor had planted, shielding

Decepticons, "Come 'brothers'" he said, "We
